meanings.definition: A surgical instrument used for scraping or cleaning the walls of a cavity.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a curette to clean the wound.
meanings.sent2: The nurse handed the curette to the surgeon during the operation.
meanings.sent3: The curette looked like a tiny spoon for the doctor to use.
meanings.sent4: Her precision with the curette was like an artist sculpting delicate clay.
meanings.sent5: The shiny curette gleamed under the bright lights of the operating room.

meanings.definition: To scrape or clean with a curette.
meanings.sent1: She will curette the plaque off the teeth carefully.
meanings.sent2: The dentist decided to curette the tartar buildup.
meanings.sent3: He curetted the dirt from the corners with a determined focus.
meanings.sent4: The gardener curetted the soil, revealing rich earth underneath.
meanings.sent5: The artist curetted away the excess paint to reveal the intricate details.
